author: asdsadsaasd12312132
body:
## Steps to reproduce

Input the code below into the PowerShell window
`Checkpoint-Computer -Description "TWC-RestorePoint" -RestorePointType MODIFY_SETTINGS`

## Expected behavior

Create a System Restore point

## Actual behavior

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/51249734/102988313-dd333200-4567-11eb-8b0c-f052a6c2ebca.png)


## Environment data

PowerShell 7.2.0-preview.2
Copyright (c) Microsoft Corporation.

https://aka.ms/powershell
Type 'help' to get help.

PS C:\Program Files\PowerShell\7-preview> Checkpoint-Computer -Description "TWC-RestorePoint" -RestorePointType MODIFY_SETTINGS
Checkpoint-Computer: The term 'Checkpoint-Computer' is not recognized as a name of a cmdlet, function, script file, or executable program.
Check the spelling of the name, or if a path was included, verify that the path is correct and try again.
PS C:\Program Files\PowerShell\7-preview>

comments.author: jdhitsolutions
comments.body: This command works in PowerShell 7.2.1 for me.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
> This command works in PowerShell 7.2.1 for me.

I guess in WinCompat :-)

We could try to restore the cmdlet https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/11732#issuecomment-580877408

title: Checkpoint computer command not recognised
